com.googlecode.aluminumproject.servlet.context

Class ServletContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.aluminumproject.context.AbstractContext
      • com.googlecode.aluminumproject.servlet.context.ServletContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Context

    public class ServletContext
extends AbstractContext
    The context that is used in a servlet environment. It contains four scopes, in order of priority:
    • The template scope (named "template");
    • The request scope (named "request");
    • The session scope (named "session");
    • The application scope (named "application").
    It has a number of implicit objects:
    • The application (named "application");
    • The request object (named "request");
    • The response object (named "response").
